title: Bitcoin Price Falls Below $40,000 in Tandem With Tech Selloff
sub_head: Digital currency hits its lowest level since August 2021, showing a tight correlation with moves in the stock market
body:
It is becoming a more common occurrence: When stocks fall, so does bitcoin.
Bitcoin, the world’s largest cryptocurrency by market value, fell 8.2% from its level late Thursday afternoon in New York to $37,988.50 Friday. The decline marked bitcoin’s lowest dollar value since August 2021, according to CoinDesk, and it is now down more than 40% from its record in November 2021.
